snippet: Despite an election season that has seen little mention of defense and foreign policy issues, more than 60 percent of Britons surveyed believed the nation should remain a “great power.”
abstract: Memo From London; study released by Chatham House, Royal Institute of International Affairs, finds that more than 60 percent of Britons still want a global role, about 30 percent would rather see closer ties with European Union rather than Washington and, of those who do have an opinion, more than 70 percent favor continued EU membership
lead_paragraph: Despite an election season that has seen little mention of defense and foreign policy issues, more than 60 percent of Britons surveyed believed the nation should remain a “great power.”

headline.print_headline: Public Survey Highlights Britons’ Global Ambitions
headline.main: Public Survey Highlights Britons’ Global Ambitions

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Chatham House (The Royal Institute of International Affairs)
